text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Israeli newspapers on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
HAARETZ
- Assad to Israeli-Arab delegation: I am committed to peace.
- Dennis Ross delays his departure: "Much work remains".
- Military court issues indictment against Hebron shooter Noam Friedman.
JERUSALEM POST
- Arafat agrees to full security cooperation.
- Netanyahu to meet Hussein in Jordan.
- Assad tells Israeli Arabs all options are open, says Netanyahu is enemy of peace.
- Prime Minister fires Suissa, signs on Reform religious council appointment.
MAARIV
- Assad to Israeli Arabs: "Netanyahu is a strange man; Barak remains committed to peace".
- Netanyahu's adviser participated in an official lunch on Tisha B'Av Jewish fast day.
- According to new study unattached Israelis have sex less than once a month.
YEDIOTH AHRONOTH
- Netanyahu in secret message to Assad: "The depth of the security arrangements will be matched by the depth of Israel's concessions on the Golan."
GLOBES
- Police recommend indictments against five key suspects in Paz affair.
- Defence Minister Mordechai wants to raise 1998 deficit target to 2.8 percent.
- Heinekin of Holland froze contacts for joint venture with Tempo until political situation in the Middle East clears up.
- Offers to buy Bank Hapoalim to be made on September 4.
